Do You Have a Head? – Introduction

30 Jan 2020

Meditation (secular or otherwise) and drugs seemed the only games in town for exploring selflessness - the one point that ancient Buddhists and new age crack-jobs seem to converge on. But recently I have been introduced to a new tool for exploring this feature of our minds - for lack of a better name headlessness.

Douglas Harding experienced, pondered, wrote, and taught about the fact that when you look out into the world you have no head. And if you then look for your head, you can’t find it.

In this series we will look at this strange idea.
